newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan names new navy chief after sacking.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan names new navy chief after sacking.

text.p: The Pakistani government on Thursday named a new naval chief, Admiral Fasih Bokhari, for a three-year term to succeed Admiral Mansurul Haque who was sacked a week ago.

Bokhari, who was previously chief of staff at the naval headquarters with the rank of vice-admiral, has been promoted to admiral and appointed Chief of Naval Staff with "immediate effect", a brief Defence Ministry announcement said.
Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif had sent Haque on forced retirement on April 24 amid newspaper reports suggesting the admiral was involved in corruption. Haque denies the charge.
It was the third sacking of a top commander of a branch of the armed forces in Pakistan's 50-year history.

Haque, who took charge of the navy in October 1994, had been the target of criticism in the Pakistani press in connection with a controversial purchase of three Agosta 90-B submarines from France in a contract signed the same year by the government of former prime minister Benazir Bhutto.
